Reviews.Title: “The friendliest place in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Joseph B
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for three months at The Hemp. Yeah, the place is more like a hostel than a hotel, so if cleanliness and high quality bedding are high on your list, this is not the place for you. But if you want to stay above an astoundingly friendly late night smoking bar located in the virtual heart of the city at a price that can't be beat, then you must stay at The Hemp. Be prepared to meet people from all over the world and stay up late every night.

Reviews.Title: “wont stay anywhere else now”
Reviews.Author: ShazzaNefertiti
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2007 with my friend in the Moroccan room. I cant recall it being unclean like some have said previously. Infact, all I remember are the wonderful staff who would do anything for you. the vertical stairs, which were amazing lol and the lovely times we had sat in the bar, being allowed to choose our own music off the computer, and when they played Dub Side of the Moon,(which I had never heard before then) they gave me a copy on disc to take home free of charge. Wonderful service, superb atmosphere. real people. You cant go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Proper easy going, very basic rooms and great fun.”
Reviews.Author: Jamesonalexander
Reviews.Content: Good if you need a place to crash where they are really cool and laid back. This is not a business style hotel, great for young people. The walls are a bit on the dirty-ish side but bearable and the great staff and laid back attitude make up for it x10. Only the building is bit tired, the bedclothes, cups, plates etc are all clean and nice as is the service. We loved our short stay of 3 nights, we accidentally broke the ceiling light in our room, we fully owned up and offered to pay for it but the owners/staff would not have a single euro and we were always met with a smile! Preferred it here rather than to stay in the very centre like Damrak Street or near there.

Reviews.Title: “The Smoker-Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Don020
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews on here, I decided to try the Hemp Hotel anyways. It cost about 60 Euros a night for a double bed with a shower and shared toilet. There was television with BBC and Comedy Central in English, and all of the staff speak predominantly English, which was nice. There is a decent breakfast every morning included free of charge. The reason I liked the Hemp Hotel is because if you are a smoker you can just be yourself and don't need to fear any sideways glances for having a doobie hanging from your mouth. All of the staff are herb-savvy, and can direct you to the nearest coffeeshops, or the ones with the best hash, and so on. The location is pretty good because you've got about 15 coffeeshops within a ten minute walk. Oh, and right next door to the hotel is an Albert Heijn, which is the perfect little grociery store to buy whatever food you want. Perfect for the herb seekers.

Reviews.Title: “Not Nice”
Reviews.Author: BDA01
Reviews.Content: The owner of this HELL hole should be ashamed. This place is gross and dirty. The rooms are disgusting, very untidy and dusty. This place needs a make over. The stair way is ridiculous. the place in all is nasty nasty nasty. The owner should be embarrassed to even have this place as an hotel. Hemp hotel never again the staff are ghetto and ridiculous they look cracked out. And the lights a so dim to hide the dust and dirt of this place. i would not allow my worst enemy to live here. They need to do a hotel inspection AND CLOSE THIS HELL HOLE DOWN

Reviews.Title: “love, love, love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrstwilky
Reviews.Content: This was a recommend by a friend who had stayed there twice before. I stayed with my husband and 2 friends and after reading previous comments was a bit scared about what we might find! Check-in was at the bar/reception (rock-salt lamps, lit ganja pipes, off-it guy chattering non-stop with the most beautiful beaming smile on his boat-race), our rooms were 1 and 3, both with views of the park. The rooms were fab! Decorated in morrocan/afghan themes with beds on the floor, blue/yellow walls, lanterns, rugs and throws. Absolutely full of character. The area around the hotel is lovely, wine shop, nice little bars and coffeeshops, lamp and furniture shops, book/clothes shops and about a 30 minute walk along the canals and streets with plenty to see to Dam Square or a 10 minute tram journey. Eccentric owner Mila (Pip:- 'Are you alright now?', Mila:- 'Yes and by that I mean noooooooo'). The stairs are steep but they are all like that in Amsterdam. The room had a few cobwebs but who cares with a view of the washing-up-liquid-foaming-fountain in the park. The breakfast was non-existent but the coffee we served was delicious. The lad in the next room was a complete wreck-head but still managed to say hello every time we clapped eyes on him. It was fabulous and I loved it. Tram number 4 from Centraal Station and get off at Fredricksplein, look for the fountain in the park, the hotel faces it. Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Steinthegreat
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has everything you need as long as you want what this is offering. It has cheap prices, good location, VERY nice staff and an amazing and cheap bar where smoking is allowed. This is perfect for bohemian people who won't pay much attention to cleanliness and standard. I can recommend this hostel very very much for anyone who enjoys cannabis, and even non-smokers can enjoy themselves in a relaxed atmosphere. Only negative part I can say is that it wasn't very clean or a good standard anywhere outside the bar/main lounge. But then again I don't care about that so this was perfect for me and my friends. Will stay here every year in Amsterdam from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff, terrible hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Teezy
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is terrible, but the service of the staff is great. I would have to agree with a former commenter who said they need to relocate to a better spot and it'd probably be a better stay. The vibe of the hotel is very bohemian, and the little complimentary packet you get in your room is cool - the candies, the hemp soap and the Amsterdam map. BUT - the rooms are a real dive. Not worth the money you pay to stay there in terms of comfort. The bathroom is a disgrace and the toilet doesn't work half the time. It's noisy from all the activity going on outside. I woke up in the morning with bites all over me. I don't know if it's because of the mosquitoes, or if there were bed bugs, but I had tiny red spots everywhere. The floor in the bar sags a bit and strikes me as somewhat of a hazard. However, they've got the right idea. Their theme suits Amsterdam, and especially any hippie types who might be drifting through. It's way different from any other place I've stayed, so it was kind of nice to experience something unlike any other hotel. They just need a better spot, or to completely renovate the building. Now with that being said, it wouldn't be fair not to compliment the staff. They were extraordinary at making you feel welcome and insisting you come in to the bar after hours and socialize... which I did, since I was traveling alone. And I had a real good time with them. One of them took my rental bike back for me in the morning since I was unable to get it back in time before I left, and another staff member offered to drive me to the airport the day I left. I was really impressed with that. That made up for the crappy accommodations, especially since I didn't spend that much time inside.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the Indian themed room one imagines...”
Reviews.Author: LoopyypooL
Reviews.Content: I'd always fancied trying the hemp hotel so although it was a little expensive for a room with shared facilities, we thought we'd give it a go. They assured us on the phone that the loo was just accross the hall. It is for 2 of the rooms, for us it was up the vertical stairs. The shower a further floor up. From speaking to some of the other residents the top floor rooms seem to be the best, you get a balcony and are further from the bar noise. Not knowing this before we booked, we had merely opted for a room theme, we chose the Indian room, aka the cupboard under the stairs. It was directly above the bar which stays open til 3 or 4am. All the stairs wrapped around our room so we got to hear everyone thundering up and down the stairs at all hours. It's a very cosy room, the double bed just fits in, with no space bvetween it and the walls. You'll never be lonely with all the flys and mosquitos buzzing around. It was nice to have breakfast served between 11am and 1pm, we couldn't miss it being that late. Just wish the coffee was bigger. Check out was also by 1pm, which is again is nice to not be thrown out at 10 when there's hours til your flight. The other big bonus is they allow smoking inside the rooms which none of the other hotels seem to

Reviews.Title: “Homely”
Reviews.Author: librasean
Reviews.Content: PLace was fantastic.Felt safe and secure.Staff were really helpful and friendly.Bar was great place to chat to people at night.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel we hope to visit again!”
Reviews.Author: mv_sweetheart
Reviews.Content: We found the Hemp Hotel in the Let's Go Europe travel book and decided the writers definitely found a hidden gem. This hotel only has five rooms, each with their own designs inspired by a different country. My boyfriend and I stayed in the Afghan room. Although it isn't a five star hotel, it is definitely a relaxing place to spend a few nights. The staff were friendly and helpful and provided us with lovely conversation during breakfast. There is a lounge connected to the hotel which serves the local crowd until the wee hours of the morning. Overall, we had a fantastic time and will definitely stay there again if we find ourselves in Amsterdam in the future.

Reviews.Title: “hell hole”
Reviews.Author: anarchy4uk
Reviews.Content: absolute [--] hole, everything makes noise, the stairs are tiny, the rooms are dirty, it really is disgusting, the staff are useless, you can hear every single noise at night. my friend opend the minnie bar and found some gone off meat. it stank the room out, the only good thing about the hemp hotel is when your stoned you piss yourself laughing about how bad it is,my m8s couldnt even close the curtains in there room. do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway In Bohemian Grunge”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuddy420
Reviews.Content: From the moment I first heard of the Hemp Hotel I knew we must visit it someday. I knew the reviews of it were quite mixed, but I loved the concept and after seeing a video of the owner, Mila giving a tour of her shop I was sold. We even extended our stay in Amsterdam for 4 days specifically to stay there. We arrived shortly after 15:00. We went into the bar (Hemp Temple) which was vacant aside from the attendant in the back. We had no problem checking in, and oddly we were not charged at the time, just given a key and told our room was â€˜all the way upâ€™. Now I must say, neither my partner nor I are in bad shape, but the staircase at The Hemp Hotel can be a workout all on its own. To get to the top floor there are 3 staircases, 2 of which are practically vertical. For those with weak hearts I would defiantly recommend a room on the first floor. Our room was quite charming in a bohemian/ earthy style. There is a very interesting mural on one of the walls and a fireplace converted with a radiator heater (which worked well). The room was very simple and almost too small for 2 people and their luggage. There was a sink with a mirror and a small cabinet for clothes. Next to the bed and close to the window there is a small wall mounted shelf with a tiny little chair so you have somewhere to â€˜writeâ€™. Also there is a television that we could never get to work sitting on a min refrigerator that also didnâ€™t work. However, I must admit it did make a very unique love nest. The hotel is situated in a nice area of the city. Just a short walk down from the Amstel, and steps away from multiple tram lines. The view from our window looked out over Frederiksplein park. Iâ€™m sure in the spring & summer, it is very beautiful. All the trees had dropped their leaves by the time we visited, but it was still quite picturesque. The bathroom situation is a story all on its own. Okay, well we had a sink in our room so we were covered there. If you wanted to use the toilet, that was down one vertical flight of stairs in the hallway. This was the single tiniest toilet I have ever been in. You practically had to slide in. The lavatory on the airplane was actually bigger. The shower or WC was right outside our room, so no stairs. Being an American, we never really knew the term WC (water closet) â€¦.but thanks to The Hemp Hotel I do now. And when they say closet their not kidding. In the wall about 2 feet from the floor there was a door (similar looking to where I might keep the towels in my hallway at home). But if you open the door and step up into it, bang youâ€™re in the shower. TIP: the little box on the wall inside with a string coming out of it that looks like it might set off the fire alarm actually turns on the light. My partner took his first shower in pitch black because he was afraid of what might happen if he pulled it. The 11:00 breakfast was not really something to wait around for in my opinion. The first morning we were there we actually went out and came back around 11:15. The same attendant from the day before greeted us and made us breakfast. The meal consisted of a hemp roll, 2 slices of cheese and a mini muffin, also tea or coffee. It did make for a nice mid-morning snack however. The entire time we stayed at The Hemp Hotel neither my partner nor I ever saw another person at the hotel except for 2 attendants. We heard the cleaning lady, and every morning around 5:00am the hall (and our room) would smell of cigarette smoke. The entire experience was defiantly very different. If you are a couple looking for an adventure, and are not disappointed easily you might enjoy the Hemp Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Our room is perfect" is what we both felt about our accomidations”
Reviews.Author: edward500
Reviews.Content: "Our room is perfect" is what we both exclaimed as we entered our room at the hemp hotel. The hotel is perfect for travelers wanting to experience real life in amsterdam. The accomidations are very european. The entire staff, ambiance and decor were all very nice. We loved this unique hotel that is tucked away in a quiet corner of amsterdam. We felt very safe, and knew the staff would help us interpret the ways of europeans that were unfamiliar to us...... we didn't know that a person ringing a bell on a bike was something to pay attention to...... For those wanting to experience europe and retreat to an american version of a hotel might want to look elsewhere. You will not find lush, new carpets and and they won't make your bed up for you. This hotel truely gives you a safe environment to experience amsterdam as real europeans do. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. It is well worth the money for the unique ambiance, decor and the hospitality of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loads of personality!!”
Reviews.Author: CristinaCZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an upgraded hostel, however it has only 5 rooms and it is in a very quiet area, very easily reachable by only 1 streetcar. Best to contact them directly to book a room. Neckbreaking staircase is typical of Amsterdam, so I don't know why anyone would complain. Really comfortable beds, but hot water happen to not work when we were there. Clean room, and tiny but clean washroom. Good value for Amsterdam, and memorable personality!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't.”
Reviews.Author: ashleybegood1
Reviews.Content: We followed the directions the site gave us to get to the hotel, and lets just say it took us 2 hours of walking around the block, getting ripped off by a cab to find it. Finally when we arrived there the hotel was closed until 2pm which it does everyday.. so we had to wait outside. The floors weren't vacuumed in the room, and we froze at night because the window wouldn't close completely. Shower was fine, and beds were surprisingly comfy. The tv stopped working after the first couple hours of watching it. This hotel is ok if all you plan on doing is sleeping, I'm sure it's better then a hostel. Another thing I hated was they didn't clean the washroom the whole time we were there (4 nights) we left a day early.

Reviews.Title: “Would def stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MissQuackers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in Amsterdam. I absolutely loved it. It is fantastically quirky, very bohemian, packed full of character & extremely laid back & friendly. Exactly what we wanted when staying in this city. The rooms have a definite hippy vibe, and are very colourful, clean & comfortable. Again, quirky is the best word to describe them. Loved the little downstairs bar in the evenings. Laughed our heads off at the resident dog walking hinself - they strapped a flashing light to his head & sent him off - very surreal! Our friends loved it too, and we would definitely stay again. Remember it's cheap & cheerful - don't expect 5 star amenities or room service!

Reviews.Title: “Hemp Heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I flew into Amsterdam early in the morning, and if there is one negative thing that I have to say about the Hemp Hotel is - early travelers, beware! - your room won't be ready until 3 pm. We were lucky because Cathy, the girl who runs reception/bar duty during the weekdays, was nice enough to fix up our room a little earlier after seeing how tired we were. She even let us nap in a vacant room while ours was being cleaned. Don't be expecting a Hilton when you come to the Hemp Hotel. For 70 euros a night you get a small - but extremely cute and quirky - room with a shower. The toilet is in the hall, but it's clean and you don't have to share it with too many people (only five rooms in the whole hotel). Both the rooms and the lobby have multi colored walls, butterflies on the ceilings, that sort of thing. The hemp hotel personifies the essence of Amsterdam. The reception/bar staff is really friendly, interesting, and everything is so CHILL! No matter what your plans are for the day, you can always start it off with a morning smoke and hemp roll - and end it with a night smoke and some hemp beer. The bar is open until four so there always something to do at your doorstep (but if you want to turn in early the noise isn't an issue). All in all, the hemp hotel is a perfect place for those seeking a fun budget time in Amsterdam. We highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “for budget travellers only...”
Reviews.Author: rockyorourke
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it looked interesting, we've been to the 'dam a few times now and wanted to try something different. However, it was not quite what we expected....After finally finding it (tiny sliver of a building!)we picked up the key for the room from the bar beneath the hotel and headed upstairs. The stairs have no handrail are amazingly steep, quite hard to believe they're actually legal in a hotel. Anyway, got into the room which was fairly small but clean. However,we soon realised that there was no toilet. I had booked a twin room with shower, assuming in my innocence that a loo came along with it! I was wrong it was outside on the landing and whilst clean it is just not something we could compromise on. The room decor was like student 'digs' (unloved rented accomodation) and if you stood by the window was in danger of developing frostbite as the draught was so bad it was like one of the windows was open. So, we beat a hasty retreat to get somewhere warm and with it's own loo (NH Schiller, where we'd been previously) This is not to say that the Hemp Hotel is terrible, it's not, just know what to expect. It's a budget hotel which is not made clear on it's website. It is defintitely not suitable for families or anyone needing the privacy of their own bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Awsome!!! This place was really fun. Loved th location...very central...loved the theme...this place is very nice, very clean, and very freindly...the room was big and had a good view of the park across the street..it was so much fun

HotelInfo.Name: Hemp Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Frederiksplein 15, Amsterdam 1017 XK, The Netherlands
